definition[0]: to make something have its effect from an earlier date
example[0]: The pay increase will be backdated to January.
definition[1]: to write an earlier date on a document or cheque than when it was actually written
definition[2]: if a change in an amount paid is backdated, it has its effect from an earlier date
example[1]: Postal workers are getting a 3.3% wage rise backdated to October.
definition[3]: to put a date on a document that is earlier than the real date
example[2]: It was alleged that he had backdated the sale documents to evade a court order.
